editors_note.headline: This week
editors_note.thesis: We're watching Agent Observability Powers Agent Evaluation — it's the one most likely to affect vendor and roadmap decisions this quarter.
editors_note.hook: We're flagging the lead for leadership — it's the one most likely to shift budgets or priorities.
editors_note.spotlight: The lead story is the most likely to change near-term decisions for teams shipping AI products.
editors_note.underhyped: Lawsuit: ChatGPT told student he was "meant for greatness"—then came psychosis deserves more attention than it's getting.
editors_note.risk: Keep an eye on Lawsuit: ChatGPT told student he was "meant for greatness"—then came psychosis — it could shift budgets or vendor assumptions.

lead_story.title: Agent Observability Powers Agent Evaluation
lead_story.what_happened: You cant validate improvements without systematic evaluation.
lead_story.our_take: Ship a proof of concept before forming an opinion. The API surface matters more than the feature list.
lead_story.what_to_do: Spin up Agent Observability in a 2-hour proof of concept — compare output against your current tool.

sections.title: Open Source Watch
sections.deck: Repos with momentum that might deserve a deeper look.

articles.title: zeroclaw
articles.summary: Depending on your setup, zeroclaw might save you time or headaches down the line (via GitHub Trending (AI/ML)).
articles.what_happened: Growing traction for zeroclaw on GitHub suggests rising builder interest.
articles.why_it_matters: Momentum behind zeroclaw is real, but maintenance quality should gate adoption decisions.
articles.what_to_do: Review zeroclaw issue tracker, last commit date, and license before considering adoption.
articles.our_take: Star velocity tells you whats popular, not whats reliable. Check the issue backlog before the star count.

articles.title: voicebox
articles.summary: Not a fire drill, but voicebox is the kind of thing that compounds if you ignore it (via GitHub Trending (AI/ML)).
articles.what_happened: Voicebox is picking up momentum in the open-source community.
articles.why_it_matters: Community interest in voicebox is growing — check repo health before committing.
articles.what_to_do: Check voicebox for recent activity, open issues, and license compatibility this week.
articles.our_take: Popularity and production-readiness are different things. Check the last commit date and open issues first.

sections.title: Lab Notes
sections.deck: Research and model updates with downstream product impact.

articles.title: After Orthogonality: Virtue-Ethical Agency and AI Alignment
articles.summary: Depending on your setup, Ethical Agency might save you time or headaches down the line (via The Gradient).
articles.what_happened: Results from Ethical Agency point to where methods may shift in the next cycle.
articles.why_it_matters: If Ethical Agency findings replicate, they could change how teams approach related problems.
articles.what_to_do: Spend 10 minutes on the Ethical Agency results — if nothing applies to your work, move on.
articles.our_take: Research signals are useful for direction-setting, not for production bets. Keep it on the watch list.

sections.title: Industry Radar
sections.deck: The moves that change product plans, budgets, and positioning.

articles.title: Lawsuit: ChatGPT told student he was "meant for greatness"—then came psychosis
articles.summary: AI Injury Attorneys target the chatbot design itself.
articles.what_happened: AI Injury Attorneys target the chatbot design itself.
articles.why_it_matters: Legal or governance pressure on ChatGPT can quickly become vendor risk for dependent teams.
articles.what_to_do: Add ChatGPT as a discussion item in your next strategy or planning meeting.
articles.our_take: Internal governance problems at major vendors should trigger a vendor-risk review, not just headlines.

articles.title: Advancing independent research on AI alignment
articles.summary: Not a fire drill, but Advancing independent research is the kind of thing that compounds if you ignore it (via OpenAI Blog).
articles.what_happened: A new paper on Advancing independent research introduces methods that may influence downstream tooling.
articles.why_it_matters: The Advancing independent research shift affects competitive positioning — worth flagging at your next planning sync.
articles.what_to_do: Bring Advancing independent research to your next planning sync — it may affect Q2 priorities.
articles.our_take: Treat Advancing independent research as a planning input — the second-order effects matter more than the headline.

articles.title: Suspect in Tumbler Ridge school shooting described violent scenarios to ChatGPT
articles.summary: If Tumbler Ridge pans out, it could change how teams approach their current stack (via The Verge AI).
articles.what_happened: Tumbler Ridge is in the news — add it to your next strategy or vendor sync.
articles.why_it_matters: Worth a slot on your next leadership review — Tumbler Ridge could shift the math.
articles.what_to_do: Bring Tumbler Ridge to your next planning sync — it may affect Q2 priorities.
articles.our_take: Strategic positioning around Tumbler Ridge is shifting faster than most roadmap cycles account for.

sections.title: Builder's Bench
sections.deck: New tooling worth evaluating in an actual workflow this week.

articles.title: GGML and llama.cpp join HF to ensure the long-term progress of Local AI
articles.summary: GGML adds a data point to a trend that's getting harder to ignore (via Hugging Face Blog).
articles.what_happened: The GGML tooling fills a gap — test it against your existing workflow before committing.
articles.why_it_matters: The GGML release addresses gaps that many builder teams have flagged.
articles.what_to_do: Try GGML on a non-critical task this week and log the results.
articles.our_take: Don't adopt tools based on hype. Run it against your ugliest edge case first.

learn_this_week.title: Machine Learning Specialization
learn_this_week.note: Andrew Ng's refreshed ML curriculum. The gold standard intro. Audit free, cert paid.

prompt_of_the_week.text: Generate a week's worth of social media posts about [topic] in the voice of a technical thought leader — concise, opinionated, no fluff.
prompt_of_the_week.why: Technical audiences punish generic content. Specifying 'opinionated, no fluff' constrains the model away from safe, bland takes — the output reads more like a real practitioner's voice.
prompt_of_the_week.tip: Replace [topic] with your area. Add 2-3 example posts you admire for tone matching.
